title: How to start writing on Quora - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, Great Question. I assume you have tried answering some questions but couldn’t form your opinion well. I understand. Happens with me a a lot (not just on quora). I have been using quora since I was 17 but wrote my first answer when after I turned 26. Yes, it took me almost 10 years. No, I was not afraid of writing. I just didn’t write. Although i wanted to. Yet, I did not. (Lazy Much!!!) Here are some few tips that will help you write better Explore Quora: Extensively. Before writing your first answer, you should know how Quora works. What people are asking. What they are expecting from answers which brings me to my next point.Interact with other People’s Content: Read. As much as you can. You want the motivation to write your first answer? Read other people’s answers. read how people are reacting to their answers. Form an opinion of your own about the question. See if you can provide any input to the already mentioned answer. If yes, appreciated what’s said and add something more. Do not agree with someone’s answer? very well, appreciate their point of view and politely provide yours. Get into conversation with people here. You will notice that eventually you will have made a community of your own with people you admire from topics you are passionate about. Nothing is more contagious than like minded people in a group.Write your first short Answer: Congrats, you have come a long way. Now let’s write your first answer. Find a question from the topic you know about. Trying Writing your first answer. For me it was Mathematics, i started solving teenagers’ math problems to acquaint myself about writing here on quora.Make a Habit of Writing One Answer Daily: Make it one a habit of writing one answer no matter how shitty, everyday. You will notice that eventually your writing skills will improve and you will be telling somebody else, how to write their first answer.PS Do not mind any errors, this is my first real answer

Edit your writing. A lot of smart people will read your script. Research every bit of your article or answer All you write about will be examined for validity and accuracy. Write sincerely and with passion. It will make your words more interesting and sincere. Answer whatever question you attempt as succinctly as possible and don’t waste words. Finally, only answer questions within your own areas of expertise. For example, if you are only average at maths don’t answer complex math questions. Again if someone wants to know about people with an IQ of 170 and you are at 125 let someone with that IQ answer the question. That is, unless you have known someone that high in intelligence very well. Even then only someone in that category “knows” what it means to be a genius. If you pose questions, word them carefully and make sure they make sense in good grammatical English. If you are not sure of something have someone who has English “smarts” read your question (or answer). Some questions I’ve read on Quora make no sense or are ambiguous. Don’t make the reader “guess” at what you want to know. Make it crystal clear. What most of us like about Quora is the unexpected. If you have some unusual perception, insight, or story to give as an answer , even if it is shocking, say it and you will find a readership. You can also make your questions a bit eccentric, iconoclastic or unusual, because perhaps someone else wants to know the answer.

Answer number: 484 Topic: System of writing in Quora Quora is a platform where some shoot some questions and some shoot answers and it’s a rapport between them that makes it a fantastic platform for knowledge gainers. Answering in Quora require some mandatory rules to follow so that, it will not only make your answer better but also secure your answer from collapsing. Here they are- Use pointsUse the bulletins in a proper way. You ain’t require to run down with garnishing sentences. Just to point lines in each bulletin.Reason:No one gives a shit to your garnishing in Quora. They want to gain knowledge in the shortest period they view your answer.PicturesI don’t use pictures always but I suggest you to use as it gives an edge to your explanation.Sense of HumorFeel happy to write. Don’t be in a hurry to gather views and upvotes. A pinch of sense of humor earns an upvote in Quora.Use bold, italicsHighlight the main words, sentences etc with bold fonts.Useless utilisationDon’t try to be cool by playing with English. Well is well, not wellz. I hate, not only me, but all, those buzzing words.Don’t use exclamation to show your expression. One “?” is enough to show your query. No meaning of, writing “?????????”Have a read over Quora Moderation onceIn my initial days many answers were collapsed. Then, I read those point.Now, I have written about 250–300 answers and I think only 1–2 answers may be collapsed.Many of my answers get uncollapsed too.Regards, The Monotonous Panda

Just Do It ~NIKE Writing on Quora is for sure one of the most addictive things for me nowadays. I am using Quora for more than 2 years but never even wrote a Question! Suddenly One day a question struck me so deep that I had to answer it and trust me since then there has been no other activity I do in my leisure time except writing on Quora. Don't worry much about your answer, you learn as you write more and also there are good and kind Quorans who correct you on the way! Now that you have decided to Write some exceptional answers, I recommend you to use some of these tips to make your answer more appealing. Use Bullet points to write different points in anwers. (You can choose numbered one also).Use the Italics and BOLD fonts to write some important line or Words.Use Images in Your answers to make it more presentable. (Do write the source of images you are using).As I'm too a fresher in this feild, I can give just this much of advice, rest you will learn yourself as you go ahead. I hope it helps! Do Upvote if you like it. Peace.

Make up a draft in your head. How you are going to present the answer, how you’re gonna tie everything up and how you’re gonna present.Next take a piece of paper and come up with the first of your answer. Remember, do it with a pencil so that you could correct the erratas, because no one is perfect.Next, sit to type the answer. If it’s difficult, you can use voice typing. Make sure you speak sound and clear.Or there’s another way, despite of being more uncivilised and crude, this one is more natural. It’s called go with the flow. Read a question, if you think you could answer that, start writing. Read your answer every once in a while before concluding. If you feel there’s something that could be added later, because it needs more research, save the draft and finish it off later. I prefer the latter.

This question is exactly for what I want to answer. I’m on Quora from a long time but I use to think 100 times before posting anything. But this corona situation has taught me that we should just do what we really want to do instead of thinking what judgments we will get if we do certain things. Like you have asked this question because you want your answer to be formed perfectly so that no one will judge you that you haven’t wrote correctly or whatever. I would say if you want to start writing so just write whatever comes in your mind, may be you’re not perfect in starting but you can only learn things by doing it and making mistakes. And I believe, #Its not about writing good or bad, Its about letting your heart out and expressing things in words. How well you read your heart, the good the writer you become. :)

Many people thinks that you must be writing expert to answer in Quora. But that is not true. Write answers to questions in topics you know well / you enjoy . As you start to write more answers, you will develop your skills. You can follow the below steps Step 1 Identify your favourite topics / you know well . For me I know about BITS Pilani and I am curious in Cosmology and have some idea regarding black holes, neutron stars, big bang etc. Step 2 Search the topic in Quora and add them to the knows about in your profile Step 3 Go to the selected topics in Quora and look if you can answer any of them. Step 4 Start writing your answer with the knowledge you have and you can refer to the google for more information. Add appropriate figures / pictures so that it will be easy for readers to understand your thoughts. Step 5 Write Write Write Write some more … Good luck and see you in action :D

Hey there fellow Quoran, My ultimate advise would be… Just start That's how I started writing on quora. Once you start writing on something you'll get a lot of support from other Quorans. • Explore Quora( figure out how things work in here, how people write and many other things) • Write about something that interests you or something that you're well versed in( it maybe anything like history, fashion or your very own life experiences) • Don't be shy or skeptical about writing on a particular topic( This is quora, people share their different opinions here and you'll not be judged for sharing your thoughts and views? • This is not Instagram or Facebook ( stop posting unnecessary pictures of yourself or girls to get upvotes. Let's not make this the second Instagram. We share knowledge here) Nandri<3

It's pretty simple actually. After you click on the question, click Answer.  Ah, I see Matt already answered this. Oh well. I shall write something in response.  That was my original response to this before I decided I didn't want another meeting with Quora Moderation. But anyway, when you are done writing, you click Done. Congratulations, you have made a viral answer!

You don't need to worry about writing. First and basic things is knowledge, if you have knowledge about sperate field, topics ,area then you are good to go. Just give the related material on what someone is asking about. Focus on your knowledge skills that's it, Once you will starting in this way, you will definitely do better.

Search for the topics which you are well versed about or aware about.. you can browse the questions and based on your expertise or experience you can start writing your answers… Make sure that you are not writing for the sake of writing, when you have something to share or if you are aware of the answer only then try to answer it.. it shall help you to be qualitative and far realistic..

Just find questions for which you can provide value in your answer. Then click ANSWER and start typing. If you find a question that is interesting but you don’t know the answer, then FOLLOW it to learn more.

You have already started writing on care when you posted this question. Keep curious. Keep questioning. Keep learning.  One day you will automatically come across that question about which you can write some good.

There’s an old rule about posting on any forum: Lurk before you leap. Spend some time reading answers to get the feel of the website, to get an idea of the styles the popular commenters use, before writing your own answers.
Please don't. If you can't figure out for yourself what, how, when to write, we do not need you here.
This is my first writing in this place but it will not be the last time, i am so confused about this but anyway finally I got it i am now writing at qoura. Love this so much . See you later friends
Good excellent and above all helpful
